extendedInfo.description: Sale! through Sept 5 for just $4.99, 50% off the regular price!!â â BirdLog is the only Android app for recording and submitting your bird sightings directly into eBird while in the field!â â Forget about notebooks, pencils and sitting at your computer. Transform your bird sightings into eBird submissions to build your own lists while sharing your sightings and supporting conservation.Youâll enter more lists with BirdLog and enter them more accurately. It is easy to tally birds as you goâand thus counting them more accurately, automatically capturing the time and duration, and using the deviceâs GPS and map interface for greater precision of locations.BirdLog was developed by active eBird users as a power app for submitting data into eBird. If you are not already familiar with eBird, we recommend that you visit ebird.org and register before using BirdLog the first time. Here's what some birders are saying about BirdLog, the only app for directly submitting sightings into eBird from the field: â âBirdLog will fundamentally change the way we go birding,â Chris Wood, eBird Project Leader.â âI enter more checklists simply because itâs so easy, and still have more free time at home.  Iâve waited for in-the-field data entry for years,â Marshall Iliff, eBird Project Manager.â âThe ability to record real-time bird observations in the field and have them flow directly into the eBird database has huge implications, not just for birders and eBird, but for citizen-science in general,â Brian Sullivan, eBird Project Manager.â âBirdLog is stunning in its simplicity and efficiency.  I now enter my almost daily observations in the field with greater accuracy in time, date, and numbers,â Ohio eBirder.BirdsEye BirdLog is the exclusive mobile data entry app for eBird that allows you to: â Plot the exact location of your sightings using your phone's GPS â Create new personal locations or choose an existing hotspot or personal location for your checklist â Create checklists even when there is no cell coverage to later submission to eBird â Enter birds quickly and easily as you see them using bird codes or full namesâ Scroll and review your checklist before submitting it Our company is committed to birds, the birding community and bird conservation. Every BirdsLog purchase you make directly supports the eBird project of the Cornell Lab of Ornithology. We think theyâre worth itânow and for the future of birds and their habitats.Notes on BirdLog v1.4: BirdLog has matured, features have been added and bugs have been fixed compared to previous versions.  Some known issues are: 1) GPS location is still a bit difficult in places with low cell coverage; 2) The default list used when there is no connection is the full North American list. This version includes the US (including Hawaii) and Canada.  Our world version, called BirdLog Worldwide is available for birders who want world coverage.  The advantage of the regional versions compared to the world version is that the lists are smaller and slightly faster because they do not need to juggle the full worldwide taxonomy, and because they offer a much shorter default list for use when creating a checklist offline.

reviews.title: Very convenient, occassional crash
reviews.comment: A very convenient tool for listing birds while on an outing, and great for submitting records to eBird. The program occassionally crashes, loosing all my data for the trip, and all previous submissions.
reviews.author: Alan Mapes

reviews.title: Convenient when a data connection is available.
reviews.comment: Very nice app, though slow to filter entire species list when a data connection is not available.  Easier to use a note taking app and submit directly to eBird later.  Crashes frequently on Samsung Galaxy II and HTC One.
reviews.author: Greg Lev

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: I enter way more checklists now, it\'s faster and easier than the old notebook
reviews.author: Abby Larson

reviews.title: Good to upload to ebird
reviews.comment: No pictures our descriptions of birds, but great for check lists
reviews.author: Christian Estrella

reviews.title: Very useful
reviews.comment: This app has almost completely replaced my taking field notes on paper.  Love the eBird integration! Developers quick to respond to feedback, and consistently work  to make improvements and kill glitches.  Some awesome birding spots are outside range of Internet... For those times I use offline checklist feature and upload once back online.
reviews.author: Todd Olson

reviews.title: Privacy problem
reviews.comment: Reads your contacts ! Noooooo!
reviews.author: But Wheat

reviews.comment: Incredibly useful for birders
reviews.author: Terrol Williams

reviews.title: Love this app
reviews.comment: User friendly  and a great tool to track birds in the field.
reviews.author: Linda Lee

reviews.title: Bummer!
reviews.comment: Im sure i will love this app if it would work. As soon as I open it and put in my user name and password it says \"error while saving your account detail\" and wont let me into the app :( Ive just sent my 2nd email to support for help. The first time didnt help me. I will re rate after I here back from them..
reviews.author: Norman Avery

reviews.title: Can I get my money back?
reviews.comment: First I thought this app would show me recent sightings in the area, but no it\'s just a log...FOR TEN BUCKS! Then it doesn\'t even validate my account, always says fail, so now I can\'t even log my sightings. Absolutely nothing about this app is worth $10 even if it did work.
reviews.author: Nathan Renn

reviews.title: Easy to use, very efficient
reviews.comment: Not as many options as Ebird in terms of breeding codes or age, but handy in the field. Can out lists in & save and then upload to Ebird when you have an internet connection
reviews.author: Laura B.

reviews.title: Love being able to submit checklists while in the field.
reviews.comment: Would be five stars if full species details could be entered.
reviews.author: Lewis Barnett

reviews.title: Needs network access
reviews.comment: New ebirder here, so very unfamiliar with the process , but the app was useless in a recent trip into backwoods Florida. No network access meant that it didn\'t even open up. What good is that? Giving 3 stars for now just to be fair...for an early review, but I frequently don\'t have service out in the woods, so I may as well keep mental notes.
reviews.author: Graham Gerdeman

reviews.title: Great app in many ways but...
reviews.comment: I gave this app its first heavy-duty workout over the weekend when we birded at Magee Marsh on Lake Erie.  The first problem I encountered when I opened the app was that it would not give me Magee Marsh Boardwalk as a hotspot.  It had us at the correct location on the map but I could not find the hotspot.  So I had to capture all of the birds at a \"fake\" location and then when I got home go on e-Bird and correct the location.  The other glitch was that sometimes I thought that I had selected a common bird but for some reason it entered a related rarity and then I had to edit that as well.  But, overall it certainly beats trying to keep notes on paper in the pouring rain.  ;-))
reviews.author: Sharon Hamersley

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Not only do I use it as an interface to eBird, I also use it as an aid in identification as an initial sieve of what I could see in the area!
reviews.author: Ricky Wyman

reviews.title: Had high hopes
reviews.comment: I really want to love this app. FC 100% of the time. Rarely finds my location, and \'cannot connect to ebird\' errors or freezes in looking up personal locations. Utterly useless in the field. I\'m disappointed. EVO 4g, EVO LTE, Xoom, Galaxy S3.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works exactly as intended
reviews.comment: This app fulfills the promise of submitting ebird checklists in the field without hassle. Great at what it does.
reviews.author: Mike Mulqueen

reviews.title: Why isn\'t this free?
reviews.comment: This app crashes my phone 90% of the time. It\'s the ONLY app that does. If it didn\'t... it\'s not worth more than .99 cents.
reviews.author: Jonathan Wilkinson

reviews.title: Been crashing 100% when i load map
reviews.comment: Edit: not usable at the moment. /Great idea, i will be using this a lot. Like the fact that it integrates with ebird.
reviews.author: Joshua Stevenson

reviews.title: Not cool
reviews.comment: They charge 10 bucks for an amateur app and now they are developing another version that they will require another purchase.  That\'s no way to treat customers.
reviews.author: Max Feken
